comments.body: Is this commented out for a reason? (It's the cause of the build failure)
These will be available in the next release so I decided to leave them here to remind us to just un-comment them when the time comes.

I'm 90% sure they're already in this release as [this Windows failure](https://dev.azure.com/conda-forge/feedstock-builds/_build/results?buildId=27305&view=logs) is normally caused by not declaring entrypoints.

```
Installing collected packages: geocube

Successfully installed geocube-0.0.2
Cleaning up...
Removed build tracker 'c:\\users\\vssadm~1\\appdata\\local\\temp\\pip-req-tracker-enm0yp'

Resource usage statistics from building geocube:
   Process count: 2
   CPU time: Sys=0:00:00.6, User=0:00:00.3
   Memory: 36.2M
   Disk usage: 118.3M
   Time elapsed: 0:00:06.0

Packaging geocube
INFO:conda_build.build:Packaging geocube-0.0.2-py_0
Packaging geocube-0.0.2-py_0
number of files: 23
[noarch_python] Noarch package contains binary script: geocube.exe
##[error]Cmd.exe exited with code '1'.
##[section]Finishing: Build recipe (maybe vs2008)
```

> Any updates on this? Anything needed from my end?

Not really. I will leave the CLI stuff commented out until we get a new release. Thanks!

> I'm 90% sure they're already in this release as this Windows failure is normally caused by not declaring entrypoints.

@chrisburr the entrypoint was declared in the setup.py but the module does not exist. That was already updated upstream and we are waiting on a new release but it is safe to merge the `noarch` now.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +12,16 @@  number: 0
  noarch: python
  # entry_points:
  #   - geocube=geocube.cli.geocube:geocube
  script: "{{ PYTHON }} -m pip install . --no-deps -vv"
